basic.floral_language:
Dianthus chinensis 
Floriography: brave, pure, warm
Dianthus chinensis gets its Chinese name 'stone bamboo' from its bamboo-like enlarged stem. 
Dianthus chinensis sports dark green leaves with strips. Single or clustered flowers born on the top of stems. Flowers have five single petals or polyphyll, slightly fragrant, and are of different colors. Commonly used for decoration of flower bed or garden. 
Dianthus chinensis likes abundant sun light. Enters into semi-dormancy in summer, and can be kept in scattered light. Flowers in May through September lasting 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-September, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, half dormant in summer, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, half dormant in summer, reduce water and fertilization
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
